page.title: 08CONSERVATION OF FISH.
page.content: The priority task of a Water Bailiff managing the stretch of the Border Esk which flows through Longtown is the conservation and protection of fish as defined in the Fisheries Protection Act 1975.With the Esk flowing into the Solway Estuary the jurisdiction of the river is under the control of the North West Water Authority.Other duties involve the restocking of the river with brown trout and salmon fry,and also constantly monitoring the discharge of effluent into drainage systems which eventually flow into the Esk.Combatting poaching is becoming an increasingly important task,as with the escalating cost of salmon and sea trout,illegal netting and poisoning of fish is on the increase.A bailiff is also required to assist chemists and biologists in the regular collection of water-samples and fish.
